    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear the contents of the buffer.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        true if the buffer is empty, false it if contains one or more terms

      • getCurrentSelection

        public java.lang.String getCurrentSelection()
        Get the currently selected contents of the buffer. The selected contents is either the display string of an InputTerm if a whole term is selected, or the display term of an individual unit of a unit within a term is selected
        Returns:
        display String

      • getInsertionIndex

        public int getInsertionIndex()
        The current insertion index, where new text is inserted. This is the character index within the whole buffer if all the contents of the buffer are concatenated together to from a String.
        Returns:
        the current insertion index

      • setInsertionIndex

        public boolean setInsertionIndex(int insertionIndex)
        Set the insertion index within the buffer. Marks the insertion index at the term and unit in which the click took place.
        Parameters:
        insertionIndex - the index
        Returns:
        true if the click was within the buffer and the insertion index updated, false otherwise

      • next

        public boolean next()
        Move the selection cursor forward one, and move the insertion index to the end of the new selection. If the current selection is a whole term, with > 1 unit, then the new selection is the first unit individually within the term. If the current selection is a unit and there are more units within the term, then the selection is the next unit in the term. If the selection is the last unit in a term (or a whole term with 1 unit), then the selection moves to the next term.
        Returns:
        true if the cursor was advanced, false if there isn't more to select

      • previous

        public boolean previous()
        Moves the selection cursor back one and moves the insertion index to the end of the new selection.
        Returns:
        true if can move to the previous, false otherwise

      • getAlternativesToSelection

        public java.util.List<Tuple<InputTerm<V>,java.lang.String>> getAlternativesToSelection()
        Obtain alternatives to the current selection, using the keys of the current selection to look them up.
        Returns:
        alternative InputTerms

      • getAlternativesToSelection2

        public java.util.List<Tuple<InputTerm<V>,java.lang.String>> getAlternativesToSelection2(java.util.List<V> text)
        Obtain alternatives to the current selection, using the keys of the current selection to look them up.
        Returns:
        alternative InputTerms

      • truncateAnticipated

        public boolean truncateAnticipated()
        Truncate current InputTerm so that it only consists of units that matched the input, discarding any anticipated portion.
        Returns:
        true there is a current term and it changed because of this call (it had anticipated text)

      • delete

        public boolean delete()
        Delete the current selection. If the selection is a whole term, then we delete the whole term. If the selection is an individual unit, then we split the current term into two terms from those units to the left of the deleted unit, and those to the right.
        Returns:
        true if selection deleted, false if no current selection to delete

      • replaceSelectionWithTerm

        public void replaceSelectionWithTerm(InputTerm<V> inputTerm)
        Replace the currently selected term with the given term. Use this when the an alternative term is selected from a list of choices.
        Parameters:
        inputTerm - the new term to replace the selection with

      • insertKey

        public java.util.List<Tuple<InputTerm<V>,java.lang.String>> insertKey(V inputKey)
        Add the new key to the buffer, updating its content to reflect the added key. Tries to contextually add the new input as best possible according to the current contents of the buffer. So we try various strategies starting with the most preferred and falling back as necessary.
        Parameters:
        inputKey - the key
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        The display String of the buffer, the display Strings of all the InputTerms in the buffer concatenated together.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        See Also:
        Object.toString()

      • toAttributedStringWithRawInsert

        public java.text.AttributedString toAttributedStringWithRawInsert(java.lang.String rawInsert)
        When inserting on-the-spot (rather than in a below-the-spot window), the raw text is inserted in-line within the text of te buffer. This method generates an AttributedString with the text inserted and the raw text highlighted.
        Parameters:
        rawInsert - text to insert
        Returns:
        the highlighted string

      • toAttributedString

        public java.text.AttributedString toAttributedString()
        Generate an AttributedString that we can use to display the uncommitted text represented by the buffer, including any highlighting for selected sections.
        Returns:
        highlighted string
